Computer_Science_tweet_117.News Finding: Facebook's gender divide  cool stuff by @username @username
Computer_Science_tweet_117.Paper Finding: The red scale shows countries with positive FGD-that is, higher proportion of males on Facebook.
Computer_Science_tweet_117.News Context: Facebook's gender divide  cool stuff by @username @username
Computer_Science_tweet_117.Paper Context: The FGD has a value below zero when women tend to be more active on Facebook that men, a value close to zero for equal activity tendencies, and a positive value when men are more active on Facebook than women in a country. The red scale shows countries with positive FGD-that is, higher proportion of males on Facebook. The scale towards FGD below zero (more tendency for women to be on Facebook) is much narrower than above zero, as can be seen in the scatter plot with the activity ratios of each gender ( Countries with strong FGD above zero are located around Africa and South West Asia, as shown on Fig.

Finding B: The red scale shows countries with positive FGD-that is, higher proportion of males on Facebook.']

Computer_Science_41.News Finding: "Not surprisingly, millennials and younger professionals were more likely to be accepting of smartphone use, but they might be doing themselves a disservice," Cardon said.
Computer_Science_41.Paper Finding: Not surprisingly, younger professionals are more accepting of mobile phone use.
Computer_Science_41.News Context: With a national sample of more than 550 full-time working professionals, the study reveals what business professionals perceive as acceptable, courteous or rude use of mobile phones in the workplace. The researchers first identified the most common grievances people had about smartphone use among their colleagues, including browsing the Internet and checking text messages. "Not surprisingly, millennials and younger professionals were more likely to be accepting of smartphone use, but they might be doing themselves a disservice," Cardon said.
Computer_Science_41.Paper Context: Based on the findings, we have made several basic conclusions. Not surprisingly, younger professionals are more accepting of mobile phone use. Interestingly, women are far less accepting of mobile phone use during informal meetings.
Computer_Science_41.text:
['Finding A: "Not surprisingly, millennials and younger professionals were more likely to be accepting of smartphone use, but they might be doing themselves a disservice," Cardon said.
Finding B: Not surprisingly, younger professionals are more accepting of mobile phone use.']
Computer_Science_41.displayed_text:
Finding A: "Not surprisingly, millennials and younger professionals were more likely to be accepting of smartphone use, but they might be doing themselves a disservice," Cardon said.
Finding B: Not surprisingly, younger professionals are more accepting of mobile phone use.

Computer_Science_544.News Finding: A foam tube wrapped with a skin was able to inch forward like a worm.
Computer_Science_544.Paper Finding: Further, we show that combining multiple robotic skins enables complex motions and functions.
Computer_Science_544.News Context:
A foam tube wrapped with a skin was able to inch forward like a worm. And a piece of skin connecting two pieces of cardboard could contract, turning the object into a rudimentary gripper. I'm Delighted I Can Do That, Dave

In unpredictable environments like outer space, where unforeseen problems can arise, this diversity gives the skins a creative advantage over traditional robots that are only designed for a limited amount of activities.
Computer_Science_544.Paper Context: We show that attaching the same robotic skin to a soft body in different ways, or to different soft bodies, leads to distinct motions. Further, we show that combining multiple robotic skins enables complex motions and functions. We demonstrate the versatility of this soft robot design approach in a wide range of applications-including manipulation tasks, locomotion, and wearables-using the same two-dimensional (2D) robotic skins reconfigured on the surface of various 3D soft, inanimate objects.
Computer_Science_544.text:
['Finding A: A foam tube wrapped with a skin was able to inch forward like a worm.
Finding B: Further, we show that combining multiple robotic skins enables complex motions and functions.']
Computer_Science_544.displayed_text:
Finding A: A foam tube wrapped with a skin was able to inch forward like a worm.
Finding B: Further, we show that combining multiple robotic skins enables complex motions and functions.

Computer_Science_101.News Finding: The algorithm assigned placements for refugees that they project would increase their chances of finding employment by roughly 40 to 70 percent compared with how the refugees actually fared, according to the new study in Science.
Computer_Science_101.Paper Finding: Our approach led to gains of roughly 40 to 70%, on average, in refugees' employment outcomes relative to current assignment practices.
Computer_Science_101.News Context: In 2016 alone, about 65.6 million people were forced to flee their homes. The algorithm assigned placements for refugees that they project would increase their chances of finding employment by roughly 40 to 70 percent compared with how the refugees actually fared, according to the new study in Science. The group, from Stanford and ETH Zurich, says the algorithm, which could be implemented at virtually no cost, could help resource-constrained governments and resettlement agencies find the best places for refugees to relocate.
Computer_Science_101.Paper Context: Our approach led to gains of roughly 40 to 70%, on average, in refugees' employment outcomes relative to current assignment practices. This approach can provide governments with a practical and cost-efficient policy tool that can be immediately implemented within existing institutional structures. It is also one of the most consequential in maximizing refugees' economic integration and self-sufficiency as a first step toward a more comprehensive integration into society (7-9).
Computer_Science_101.text:
['Finding A: The algorithm assigned placements for refugees that they project would increase their chances of finding employment by roughly 40 to 70 percent compared with how the refugees actually fared, according to the new study in Science.
Finding B: Our approach led to gains of roughly 40 to 70%, on average, in refugees\' employment outcomes relative to current assignment practices.']
Computer_Science_101.displayed_text:
Finding A: The algorithm assigned placements for refugees that they project would increase their chances of finding employment by roughly 40 to 70 percent compared with how the refugees actually fared, according to the new study in Science.
Finding B: Our approach led to gains of roughly 40 to 70%, on average, in refugees' employment outcomes relative to current assignment practices.

Computer_Science_398.News Finding: Whether that's the case, we're certainly seeing a lot of new additions to dictionaries, and a lot of those new additions are slang terms with which your average Internet denizen will be pretty familiar.
Computer_Science_398.Paper Finding: Our analyses revealed two significant patterns in the data: languages that had larger speaker populations tended to have higher rates of gain of new words in basic vocabulary than their smaller sister languages, and smaller populations tended to have higher rates of word loss from basic vocabulary (Table 1 and Fig.
Computer_Science_398.News Context: So it seems possible that with the globalisation made possible through the Internet, the English language should be changing at a faster rate than ever before. Whether that's the case, we're certainly seeing a lot of new additions to dictionaries, and a lot of those new additions are slang terms with which your average Internet denizen will be pretty familiar. This quarter's update shows that contemporary culture continues to have an undeniable and fascinating impact on the language."
Computer_Science_398.Paper Context: The models varied in (i) whether the data were phylogenetically structured or not, (ii) whether new populations rapidly achieved a stable population size upon colonizing a new area, or underwent a more protracted period of growth, (iii) whether new languages formed by an allopatric process, where a parent population underwent fission to produce two daughter populations, or by a peripatric process, where the parent population gave rise to a daughter population by a process of colonization, and (iv) whether or not new languages experienced a founder effect, losing a number of words when a new population became established (Methods). Our analyses revealed two significant patterns in the data: languages that had larger speaker populations tended to have higher rates of gain of new words in basic vocabulary than their smaller sister languages, and smaller populations tended to have higher rates of word loss from basic vocabulary (Table 1 and Fig. Variation in population size explained about 10-20% of the variation in word gains and losses (Table 1) .
Computer_Science_398.text:
['Finding A: Whether that\'s the case, we\'re certainly seeing a lot of new additions to dictionaries, and a lot of those new additions are slang terms with which your average Internet denizen will be pretty familiar.
Finding B: Our analyses revealed two significant patterns in the data: languages that had larger speaker populations tended to have higher rates of gain of new words in basic vocabulary than their smaller sister languages, and smaller populations tended to have higher rates of word loss from basic vocabulary (Table 1 and Fig.']

Computer_Science_413.News Finding: The study found significant positive correlations between video-game guilt and the moral foundations violated during game play.
Computer_Science_413.Paper Finding: These results provide strong convergent and discriminant validity for the potential that playing an immoral character in a video game leads to an increased salience of content-relevant intuitions mediated by the moral emotion of guilt.
Computer_Science_413.News Context:
Grizzard explains that in life and in game, specific definitions of moral behavior in each domain will vary from culture to culture and situation to situation. advertisement

"For instance," he says, "an American who played a violent game 'as a terrorist' would likely consider his avatar's unjust and violent behavior -- violations of the fairness/reciprocity and harm/care domains -- to be more immoral than when he or she performed the same acts in the role of a 'UN peacekeeper.'" The study found significant positive correlations between video-game guilt and the moral foundations violated during game play.
Computer_Science_413.Paper Context: All other models fail to meet the a priori determined criteria. These results provide strong convergent and discriminant validity for the potential that playing an immoral character in a video game leads to an increased salience of content-relevant intuitions mediated by the moral emotion of guilt. Furthermore, by utilizing random assignment and a sequential model, the findings provide evidence of causation.
Computer_Science_413.text:
['Finding A: The study found significant positive correlations between video-game guilt and the moral foundations violated during game play.
Finding B: These results provide strong convergent and discriminant validity for the potential that playing an immoral character in a video game leads to an increased salience of content-relevant intuitions mediated by the moral emotion of guilt.']
Computer_Science_413.displayed_text:
Finding A: The study found significant positive correlations between video-game guilt and the moral foundations violated during game play.
Finding B: These results provide strong convergent and discriminant validity for the potential that playing an immoral character in a video game leads to an increased salience of content-relevant intuitions mediated by the moral emotion of guilt.

Computer_Science_403.News Finding: The researchers compared the calorie content of the ordered lunches and found that each label reduced the calories ordered by 10 percent.
Computer_Science_403.Paper Finding: Each label type reduced lunch calories by approximately 10%.
Computer_Science_403.News Context: Published in the Journal of Public Policy Marketing, the results from the study -- the first online food ordering field experiment -- suggest that consumers benefit from easier to understand information about what is, and isn't, a healthy food choice. The researchers compared the calorie content of the ordered lunches and found that each label reduced the calories ordered by 10 percent. "Calorie labeling appears to be effective in an online environment where consumers have fewer distractions, and the simpler traffic-light labeling seems as effective as standard calorie numbers," said Eric M. Van Epps, a 2015 CMU alumnus who is a postdoctoral researcher at the University of Pennsylvania's Perelman School of Medicine.
Computer_Science_403.Paper Context: Each label type reduced lunch calories by approximately 10%. Nutrition knowledge was not improved by any menu format. Traffic light labels achieved meaningful reductions in calories ordered even in the absence of numeric information, and the authors found no apparent benefit or detriment of combining label types.
Computer_Science_403.text:
['Finding A: The researchers compared the calorie content of the ordered lunches and found that each label reduced the calories ordered by 10 percent.
Finding B: Each label type reduced lunch calories by approximately 10%.']
Computer_Science_403.displayed_text:
Finding A: The researchers compared the calorie content of the ordered lunches and found that each label reduced the calories ordered by 10 percent.
Finding B: Each label type reduced lunch calories by approximately 10%.

Computer_Science_tweet_134.News Finding: The myth of cognitive decline. This has certainly received a lot of press in the last 24 hrs.  (free access for now)
Computer_Science_tweet_134.Paper Finding: Once the cost of processing this extra information is controlled for in studies of human performance, findings that are usually taken to suggest declining cognitive capacities can be seen instead to support little more than the unsurprising idea that choosing between or recalling items becomes more difficult as their numbers increase.
Computer_Science_tweet_134.News Context: The myth of cognitive decline. This has certainly received a lot of press in the last 24 hrs.  (free access for now)
Computer_Science_tweet_134.Paper Context: Given that the models run (and can be rerun) on computers, the possibility that any differences in their performance are due to aging hardware can be eliminated; instead, their patterns of performance reflect the information-processing costs that must inevitably be incurred as knowledge is acquired. Once the cost of processing this extra information is controlled for in studies of human performance, findings that are usually taken to suggest declining cognitive capacities can be seen instead to support little more than the unsurprising idea that choosing between or recalling items becomes more difficult as their numbers increase. We suggest that the answer to this question lies in the way that psychometric tests neglect learning and its relationship to the statistical patterns that characterize human experience.
Computer_Science_tweet_134.text:
['Finding A: The myth of cognitive decline. This has certainly received a lot of press in the last 24 hrs. (free access for now)
Finding B: Once the cost of processing this extra information is controlled for in studies of human performance, findings that are usually taken to suggest declining cognitive capacities can be seen instead to support little more than the unsurprising idea that choosing between or recalling items becomes more difficult as their numbers increase.']
Computer_Science_tweet_134.displayed_text:
Finding A: The myth of cognitive decline. This has certainly received a lot of press in the last 24 hrs. (free access for now)
Finding B: Once the cost of processing this extra information is controlled for in studies of human performance, findings that are usually taken to suggest declining cognitive capacities can be seen instead to support little more than the unsurprising idea that choosing between or recalling items becomes more difficult as their numbers increase.

Computer_Science_127.News Finding: It turned out that refugees with particular backgrounds or skills achieved better outcomes in some locations than others.
Computer_Science_127.Paper Finding: This indicates that there are synergies between places and people; certain characteristics will make a refugee a better match for a particular location.
Computer_Science_127.News Context: They found that the refugees' eventual economic self-sufficiency depended on a combination of their individual characteristics, such as education level and knowledge of English, and where they were resettled within the country. It turned out that refugees with particular backgrounds or skills achieved better outcomes in some locations than others. In 2016 alone, about 65.6 million people were forced to flee their homes.
Computer_Science_127.Paper Context: Finally, the expected employment returns associated with personal characteristics can vary across different resettlement locations (Fig. This indicates that there are synergies between places and people; certain characteristics will make a refugee a better match for a particular location. In Switzerland, for example, we find that the ability to speak French (i.e., among French-speaking African refugees) results in a larger payoff for refugees assigned to Frenchspeaking cantons than for those assigned to German-speaking cantons ( fig.
Computer_Science_127.text:
['Finding A: It turned out that refugees with particular backgrounds or skills achieved better outcomes in some locations than others.
Finding B: This indicates that there are synergies between places and people; certain characteristics will make a refugee a better match for a particular location.']

Finding B: This indicates that there are synergies between places and people; certain characteristics will make a refugee a better match for a particular location.

Computer_Science_126.News Finding: The researchers found that people remember information better if it is presented to them in a virtual environment.
Computer_Science_126.Paper Finding: If their active participation in the organization of the data in virtual memory palaces makes a meaningful difference, then that could be further useful in designing interaction-based virtual environments that could one day assist in far superior information management and recall tools than those currently available to us.
Computer_Science_126.News Context: The researchers found that people remember information better if it is presented to them in a virtual environment. "This data is exciting in that it suggests that immersive environments could offer new pathways for improved outcomes in education and high-proficiency training," says Amitabh Varshney, professor of computer science and dean of the College of Computer, Mathematical, and Natural Sciences at UMD. The results showed an 8.8 percent improvement overall in recall accuracy using the VR headsets, a statistically significant number according to the research team.
Computer_Science_126.Paper Context: Another interesting future work would be to allow people to build their own virtual memory palaces, manipulate and organize the content on their own, and then ask them to recall that information. If their active participation in the organization of the data in virtual memory palaces makes a meaningful difference, then that could be further useful in designing interaction-based virtual environments that could one day assist in far superior information management and recall tools than those currently available to us. Yet another interesting future direction of research could be to compare elements of virtual memory palaces that are highly personal versus those that could be used by larger groups.
Computer_Science_126.text:
['Finding A: The researchers found that people remember information better if it is presented to them in a virtual environment.
Finding B: If their active participation in the organization of the data in virtual memory palaces makes a meaningful difference, then that could be further useful in designing interaction-based virtual environments that could one day assist in far superior information management and recall tools than those currently available to us.']
Computer_Science_126.displayed_text:
Finding A: The researchers found that people remember information better if it is presented to them in a virtual environment.
Finding B: If their active participation in the organization of the data in virtual memory palaces makes a meaningful difference, then that could be further useful in designing interaction-based virtual environments that could one day assist in far superior information management and recall tools than those currently available to us.

Computer_Science_tweet_187.News Finding: A new universal of language processing: nouns slow down speech! Read our new PNAS paper at
Computer_Science_tweet_187.Paper Finding: These conditions on noun use appear to outweigh potential advantages stemming from differences in internal complexity between nouns and verbs.
Computer_Science_tweet_187.News Context: A new universal of language processing: nouns slow down speech! Read our new PNAS paper at
Computer_Science_tweet_187.Paper Context: We attribute this slowdown effect to the increased amount of planning that nouns require compared with verbs. These conditions on noun use appear to outweigh potential advantages stemming from differences in internal complexity between nouns and verbs. Our findings suggest that, beneath the staggering diversity of grammatical structures and cultural settings, there are robust universals of language processing that are intimately tied to how speakers manage referential information when they communicate with one another.
Computer_Science_tweet_187.text:
['Finding A: A new universal of language processing: nouns slow down speech! Read our new PNAS paper at
Finding B: These conditions on noun use appear to outweigh potential advantages stemming from differences in internal complexity between nouns and verbs.']
Computer_Science_tweet_187.displayed_text:
Finding A: A new universal of language processing: nouns slow down speech! Read our new PNAS paper at
Finding B: These conditions on noun use appear to outweigh potential advantages stemming from differences in internal complexity between nouns and verbs.

Computer_Science_108.News Finding: The findings, published in the journal Management Science, shows airlines improved their median departure time between 3.3 to 4.2 minutes and reduced average departure delays between 1.3 to 2 minutes, depending on whether they charged for the first or second checked bag.
Computer_Science_108.Paper Finding: We show that, at the aggregate level, the airlines that began charging for one checked bag saw a significant relative improvement in their on-time departure performance in the 35-day period afterwards, compared to the airlines that were not charging for a checked bag during the same time period.
Computer_Science_108.News Context: The below-the-cabin effect dominates the above-the-cabin effect." The findings, published in the journal Management Science, shows airlines improved their median departure time between 3.3 to 4.2 minutes and reduced average departure delays between 1.3 to 2 minutes, depending on whether they charged for the first or second checked bag. The reductions are significant because departure times and mitigating delays are crucial to so many other facets of the business, such as the number of flights airlines can offer and their image among potential customers.
Computer_Science_108.Paper Context: As Southwest Airlines might have gotten new customers who used to fly the now-baggage fee charging airlines, we do not have a true experiment, and consequently we do not employ a traditional difference-in-difference approach in our analysis. We show that, at the aggregate level, the airlines that began charging for one checked bag saw a significant relative improvement in their on-time departure performance in the 35-day period afterwards, compared to the airlines that were not charging for a checked bag during the same time period. When grouped into 'low-cost' versus 'legacy' carriers, however, we find opposite effects: the departure performance of the low-cost airlines became worse while it improved for the legacy carriers.
Computer_Science_108.text:
['Finding A: The findings, published in the journal Management Science, shows airlines improved their median departure time between 3.3 to 4.2 minutes and reduced average departure delays between 1.3 to 2 minutes, depending on whether they charged for the first or second checked bag.
Finding B: We show that, at the aggregate level, the airlines that began charging for one checked bag saw a significant relative improvement in their on-time departure performance in the 35-day period afterwards, compared to the airlines that were not charging for a checked bag during the same time period.']
Computer_Science_108.displayed_text:
Finding A: The findings, published in the journal Management Science, shows airlines improved their median departure time between 3.3 to 4.2 minutes and reduced average departure delays between 1.3 to 2 minutes, depending on whether they charged for the first or second checked bag.
Finding B: We show that, at the aggregate level, the airlines that began charging for one checked bag saw a significant relative improvement in their on-time departure performance in the 35-day period afterwards, compared to the airlines that were not charging for a checked bag during the same time period.
